Resource: Human Biomonitoring. Basics: educational course
Owner: World Health Organization. Regional Office for Europe

Resource: How to FAIR: a website to guide researchers on making research data more FAIR
Owner: Danish National Forum for Research Data Management, with support from Denmark's Electronic Research Library (DEFF) and the Danish e-Infrastructure Cooperation (DeiC).

Resource: HHEAR Exposomics Webinar Series
Owner: Human Health Exposure Analysis Resource (HHEAR), NIEHS

Resource: Chemical contaminants in food and feed
Additional remarks: Latest topics on Chemical contaminants in food and feed with information on  links to latest news published on these topics; legislation and general information of major contaminants

Resource: Data analysis using the R language for statistical computing-Lecture 1 (Part 1)
Owner: Humboldt University organized and lectured by Dr Danny Arends
Additional remarks: This is a live-stream recording included in a 50+ hour MSc and PhD lecture series: "Data analysis using the R language for statistical computing", given digitally during the Covid19 pandemic at the Humboldt University in Berlin organized and lectured by Dr Danny Arends.

Resource: IUCLID for Applicants
Additional remarks: EFSA: IUCLID Training for applicants (sessions 18/3 & 22/3). IUCLID stands for "International Uniform Chemical Information Database." It's a software application used to create, store, and exchange data on intrinsic and hazard properties of chemical substances. It's a crucial tool for regulatory bodies, such as EFSA (European Food Safety Authority), for the evaluation of chemical substances used in various applications, including food safety.

Resource: Clearing some of the highest FAIR hurdles: PIDs, Metadata, and Semantic Interoperability for Researchers (2021)
Additional remarks: FAIRsFAIR webinar series aims at enabling sustainable technical implementation of the FAIR principles. FAIRsFAIR invites researchers to a presentation of the essential techniques to adopt in making data FAIR.

Resource: FAIRsFAIR webinar: Persistence and interoperability in FAIR research data management  (2020)
Additional remarks: FAIRsFAIR webinar: The main principles of FAIR data (findable, accessible, interoperable and reusable) have received wide acceptance in scientific data management circles, the webinar present the main findings of FAIRsFAIR EU regarding "Persistence and interoperability in FAIR research data management"

Resource: Rapid Assessment of Contaminant Exposure (RACE) tool (2020)
Additional remarks: Webinar (held on 2020) about the RACE tool. The tool is based on the methodology proposed in the EFSA technical report “Risk evaluation of Chemical contaminants in food in the context of RASFF notifications”, which was published on 15 May 2019. The tool provides estimates of acute and chronic exposure of different population groups to individual food chemical contaminants and compares the result with the health-based guidance value or other relevant toxicological reference points.

Resource: The importance of risk assessments: A European perspective (2022)
Additional remarks: Webinar held in 2022 by IOSH, topics - The importance of risk assessments, who is responsible and what to consider; - How the changing world of work affects risk assessment and requirements of OSH professionals in the face of these changes; - Best practice examples of how risk assessments have been adapted to remain effective

Resource: EFSA International Workshop on Risk Assessment of Combined Exposure to Multiple Chemicals (2021)
Additional remarks: This workshop programme  held in 2021, included presentations and discussion groups exploring questions on Scientific Criteria for grouping chemicals into assessment groups and future challenges in risk assessment of combined exposure to multiple chemicals (chemical mixtures)

Resource: Risk communication essentials
New developments and regulatory applications of the OECD QSAR Toolbox
Additional remarks: This webinar introduces the QSAR Toolbox together with practical advice on how to use its new and essential features.

Resource: QSARs and their assessment under dossier evaluation
Additional remarks: The webinar covers the requirements for the use of QSAR results as adaptations to standard information in REACH registrations, and how ECHA evaluates the compliance of QSAR information.  The webinar is particularly addressed to REACH registrants, who may include QSAR results in their registration dossiers and to stakeholders interested in learning about ECHA’s methods on evaluating QSAR results.

Resource: OECD QSAR Toolbox applications for REACH and beyond
Additional remarks: The webinar presents the experience of different stakeholders using the QSAR Toolbox.

Resource: Towards faster regulatory action: ECHA's approach to assessing chemicals in groups
Additional remarks: This webinar explains ECHA's approach to assessments of regulatory needs of several substances, upcoming improvements for how to inform registrants about published assessments, and how to react in case their substance is addressed in a group assessment.

Resource: In Vitro Assays for (Bio)monitoring of Chemical Mixtures u2013 From the Environment to People
Owner: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences
Additional remarks: This seminar discusses in vitro tools to assess toxicology of chemical mixtures

Resource: Clustering and Classification Workshop: Applications to Investigate Adverse Effects of Chemicals on Human Health and Environment
Owner: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences

Resource: Improving Mixtures Health Assessments: Combining In Silico with In Vitro / In Vivo Models to Evaluate Co-occurring Contaminant
Owner: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences
Additional remarks: Methods to evaluate exposure to combined exposures and chemical mixtures, including computer models

Resource: NanoHarmony Training Material - From science to standards and harmonised OECD Test Guidelines
Additional remarks: The Training Material is divided into 4 different modules, each focussing on a specific topic: 1) Importance of standardised and harmonised methods; 2) The OECD and its relevant committees; 3) OECD documents and Test Guidelines; 4) Process of development of OECD documents.

Toxicology and hazard assessment

New approach methods as door-openers for drugs and vaccines or the other way around?
The use of Artificial Intelligence in Toxicology
One Health Approach to Risk Assessment (OHARA)
Owner: National Collaborating Centre for Environmental Health (NCCEH)

Resource: Next generation physiologically based kinetic modelling: challenges and opportunities
QSAR and read-across in the assessment of plant protection products
Workshop on gap analysis and data requirements to support Test Guidelines and Guidance Document development
Additional remarks: A series of 14 expert sessions on 11 topics related to ENMs testing

Resource: EUROTOX Webinar: Exposome toxicology: Combining different types of stressors held earlier today
Domain: Exposure Assessment;Hazard and Risk;Policy and regulation
